p: 2. Descartes overlooked the “sum” in “cogito ergo sum.” We could begin with Descartes, who is credited with starting modern philosophy by discovering the cogito sum [“I think, therefore, I am”]. He studied the cogito but entirely neglected the sum, the “I am,” even though the sum is just as basic as the cogito. By contrast, the present studyasks about the sum. Only if we establish its nature can we understand any cogitationes [thoughts].
